body.head.byline: By JULIA WERDIGIER and JEREMY W. PETERS

block.p: It was another busy week for Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company, which joined with Stefano Pessina, an Italian billionaire, on Tuesday to claim victory in a takeover battle for Alliance Boots, Britain's largest drugstore chain, sealing Europe's biggest leveraged buyout.
Kohlberg Kravis and Mr. Pessina, Alliance Boots' deputy chairman and its largest shareholder, agreed to pay £11.1 billion ($22 billion) for Alliance Boots after raising their bid three times.

It was another busy week for Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company, which joined with Stefano Pessina, an Italian billionaire, on Tuesday to claim victory in a takeover battle for Alliance Boots, Britain's largest drugstore chain, sealing Europe's biggest leveraged buyout.
Kohlberg Kravis and Mr. Pessina, Alliance Boots' deputy chairman and its largest shareholder, agreed to pay £11.1 billion ($22 billion) for Alliance Boots after raising their bid three times.

Separately, Kohlberg Kravis joined Goldman Sachs in an $8 billion deal to take Harman International Industries private. In a twist, the buyers offered to give Harman shareholders a chance to retain a stake in the newly private company and share in any profit if the company is later sold or taken public.

K.K.R. and Mr. Pessina have to make the Boots acquisition worthwhile after paying 14 percent more for the company than initially planned. Its provision with Harman shareholders, meanwhile, might signal a new tack for private equity deals in assuaging stockholders.
JULIA WERDIGIER and JEREMY W. PETERS
